title: Content Delivery Network (CDN)
description: content delivery network, or content distribution network (CDN), is a geographically distributed network of proxy servers and their data centers.
key-ideas: CDNs improve permance by distributing request load across multiple systems and data centers.
CDNs can improve availability, high availability, fault tolerance, and reliability.
CDNs are extremely versatile and capable of hosting a wide array of proxied services.
CDNs may be related to edge computing or edge servers.
